intro: Bupleurum smithii var. parvifolium, commonly known as the small-leaved American bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants with umbellate inflorescences. The plant features slender stems and small, white to pale purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or rocky slopes.
